intro: Erigeron tephrodes, commonly known as the tephrodes fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron tephrodes is often found in arid regions and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient environments.
